page.title: 18EDUCATION and YOUTH SERVICE.
page.content: EDUCATION AND THE YOUTH SERVICE. {Kenilworth state schools}are controlled by the{Warwickshire County {Council.}Children{start school}at the age of{five}and can{leave}at{sixteen {or stay on}for a further{two years prior to{further education}at{College, {University}or to{start work.}There are {11}schools in the town.{1 Nursery school (pre 5's){2 First Schools (5 to 8's){2 Middle schools}(8 to 12's){3 Combined schools (5}to 12's) and{1 Comprehensive}school made up of {2 Halls}(units) for 12 to 16's and{1 {Hall}for 16 to 18's.{Kenilworth}also has{2 Private schools.}A{modern Youth {Centre}is situated in the centre of the town on Bertie Road. It is very {popular, open every night bar Sundays and{offers}a wide{variety}of{sports and{activities}for its{members}whose {ages}range{between 12 and 21.
